column2: What is prohibited when antiskid is inoperative for takeoff?
column3:
When antiskid is inoperative:

• Assumed temperature (reduced thrust) takeoff is prohibited
• Full rated takeoff thrust must be used

column2: What limitations apply when taking off with both EECs in ALTERNATE mode?
column3:
When both EECs are in ALTERNATE mode for takeoff:

• 737-800: 26K max (27K max, if planned) takeoff thrust only
• 737-MAX8: Full rated takeoff thrust only
• Reduced or assumed temperature thrust is prohibited
• Do NOT use FMC takeoff N1
• Do NOT use FMC QRH V-speeds
• Autothrottle must NOT be used for takeoff

column2: What are the limitations associated with 27K bump (737-800)?
column3:
27K bump (737-800 only):

• May be used only if specifically authorized by Dispatch
• Must be specified on the load agent–generated TPS
• May NOT be selected or requested through ACARS unless TPS is based on 27K thrust
• KSNA operations are excluded from this limitation
